module.name: GroupedEdit
module.short: Provides the base class for grouped edit controls.

descr.p: groupededit.pp provides a base class where a TCustomMaskEdit (derived) control is grouped inside a TCustomControl with another TControl derived class. The objective of this base class is to forward all relevant methods and properties of TCustomMaskEdit. Grouping the controls inside a TCustomControl is done, so that the resulting control can be aligned and anchored.
Initial implementation: 2016 by Bart Broersma

element.name: TGEEdit
element.short: Implements the edit control used in TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.

descr.p: TGEEdit is a TCustomMaskedit descendant which implements the edit control used in TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit. TGEEdit provides an overridden method to handle Tab keys. The key can be frowarded to the control that owns the class instance, to the ancestor class, or simply discarded.
TGEEdit is the type used to implement the BaseEditor property in TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.

element.name: TGEEdit.PerformTab
element.short: Handles Tab key presses for the control.

element.name: TGEEdit.PerformTab.Result
element.short: True when the Tab key has been handled.

element.name: TGEEdit.PerformTab.ForwardTab
element.short: True forwards the key to the ancestor class.

element.name: TGEEditClass
element.short: Class type used to create instances of TGEEdit.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit
element.short: Implements a grouped edit control.

descr.p: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit is a TCustomControl descendant which implements a grouped edit control. TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit is composed of a TGEEdit control that provides an editor for the control value, and a related TControl descendant.

TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit basically acts as a container for the grouped controls, and ensures that Aligment and Anchoring are performed. TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit forwards relevant methods and properties to the BaseEditor or Buddy members, and receives event notifications from both.
Derived classes should implement their own BaseEditor and Buddy properties so that they will have the correct class types.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers the widget set class used to create new instances of the grouped edit.

descr.p: Calls the inherited method, and registers the following properties to be skipped during LCL component streaming:

dl.dd: Used in a previous version of Lazarus
Used in a previous version of Lazarus

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CalculatePreferredSize
element.short: Calculates the preferred size for the control with optional space reserved by theme services.

descr.p: CalculatePreferredSize is an overridden procedure used to calculate the dimensions for the control. The calculated values are returned in PreferredWidth and PreferredHeight.

CalculatePreferredSize calls the inherited method, and forwards the method call to the BaseEditor control. When AutoSizeHeightIsEditHeight is set to True, the value calculated as the control height in BaseEditor is used as the value in the PreferredHeight argument. The value in PreferredWidth is always set to zero (0).

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CalculatePreferredSize.PreferredWidth
element.short: Width for the control; always zero in the method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CalculatePreferredSize.PreferredHeight
element.short: Height for the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CalculatePreferredSize.WithThemeSpace
element.short: Indicates if additional space needed for theme services is reserved.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CreateBuddy
element.short: Creates the TControl instance assigned to the Buddy property.

descr.p: CreateBuddy is a TControl function used to create the TControl instance assigned to the Buddy property. CreateBuddy calls GetBuddyClassType to get the class reference used to create new instances of the control, and calls its Create method using the current class instance as the owner for the TControl instance.
CreateBuddy is used the Create constructor.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CreateBuddy.Result
element.short: TControl instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CreateEditor
element.short: Creates the TGEEdit instance used in the BaseEditor property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CreateEditor.Result
element.short: TGEEdit instance created in the method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.FocusAndMaybeSelectAll
element.short: Gives focus to the control, and optionally selects text in its editor.

descr.p: FocusAndMaybeSelectAll is a procedure used to give focus to the control, and to optionally select text in its editor. FocusAndMaybeSelectAll calls the SetFocus method in BaseEditor to ensure that the editor portion of the grouped edit control has focus.

The value in AutoSelect is used to determine the selected text in the BaseEditor control. When AutoSelect is set to True, the SelectAll method in BaseEditor is called to select all of the content in the control. When False, the SelStart method in BaseEditor is set to the maximum value for an Integer, ensuring that the caret position is located at the end of the control value.
FocusAndMaybeSelectAll is used in the implementation of the BuddyClick method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetBuddyVisible.AValue
element.short: True to display the Buddy control, False to hide it.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.BuddyClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Buddy control is clicked.

descr.p: Used in internal methods to redirect events from the Buddy control to the container class (the current class instance).
BuddyClick uses the value in ReadOnly to determine if the grouped edit control should respond to a Click event from the Buddy control. When ReadOnly is True, no actions are performed in the method.

BuddyClick signals the OnBuddyEvent handler (when assigned). When the BuddyClick code points to this method (and not an overridden one in a descendant), the FocusOnBuddyClick method is called to determine if focus and selection changes are handled by the current class instance.

Derived controls may override BuddyClick to run a dialog after calling the inherited method. In this scenario, selecting the text in this method is most likely premature. It is the responsibility of the derived control to implement focus changes and selection as needed.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.DoEnter
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control is entered.

descr.p: DoEnter is an overridden procedure used to perform actions needed when the control is entered using keyboard navigation. DoEnter calls the inherited DoEnter method to signal the OnEnter event handler, and calls the SetFocus method in BaseEditor at run-time. The focus change is not performed at design-time.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.EditChange
element.short: Signals the OnEditChange event handler, when assigned.

descr.p: EditChange is a procedure used to signals the OnEditChange event handler, when assigned. EditChange is used in the implementation of the InternalOnEditChange method, which is assigned as the OnChange event handler in the BaseEditor property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.EditClick
element.short: Signals the internal OnEditClick event handler, when assigned.

element.short: Indicates if BaseEditor can be modified.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.GetSel
element.short: Gets the offsets for the current text selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.GetSel._SelStart
element.short: Starting position for the text selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.GetSel._SelStop
element.short: Ending position for the text selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.GetSpacing
element.short: Gets the value for the Spacing property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.GetSpacing.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetSel
element.short: Sets the current text selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetSel._SelStart
element.short: Initial position selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetSel._SelStop
element.short: Final position selected in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions when the control has finished loading in the LCL streaming mechanism.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Reset
element.short: Forwards a Reset method call to the BaseEditor in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetAutoSize
element.short: Sets the value for the AutoSize property.

descr.p: SetAutoSize is overridden in TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit, and calls the inherited method on entry. It ensures that the new value for the property is applied to AutoSize property in BaseEditor.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetAutoSize.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetColor
element.short: Sets the value for the Color property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetColor.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetCursor
element.short: Sets the value for the Cursor property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetCursor.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.ShouldAutoAdjust
element.short: Indicates if the height or width is affected during auto-adjust.
element.descr: AWidth is set to True in TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit. AHeight is set to False when AutoSize is True, and vice-versa.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.AutoSelect
element.short: Indicates if the text in the control is automatically selected when focus is received.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.AutoSelected
element.short: Indicates if the current text selection was performed automatically.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Buddy
element.short: Represents the associated TControl instance in the grouped edit control.

descr.p: Buddy normally contains a TSpeedButton, TUpDown or similar control. Derived classes may implement a different class type for the control using the GetBuddyClassType method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.BuddyCaption
element.short: Caption used for the Buddy control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.BuddyCursor
element.short: Cursor shape used for the Buddy control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.BuddyHint
element.short: Hint displayed for the Buddy control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.BuddyWidth
element.short: Width for the Buddy control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Color
element.short: Background color for the BaseEdit in the control.

descr.p: Does not apply to the Buddy control (button); buttons always used the system-defined color for the button surface.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.DirectInput
element.short: Indicates if text can be entered directly into the BaseEditor control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.BaseEditor
element.short: Represents the control used as the editor for the value in the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.EditMask
element.short: Contains the masking characters used in the editor for the control.

descr.p: EditMask is a String property that contains the masking characters used in the editor for the control. EditMask redirects read and write access for the property to the TGEEdit instance in the BaseEditor property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.EditText
element.short: Contains the value entered in the control including masking characters.

descr.p: EditText is a String property which contains the value entered in the control including masking characters. Read and write access to the property value are redirected to the BaseEditor control.
Use the Text property to access the actual characters in the control value, excluding any characters introduced by an edit mask.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.FocusOnBuddyClick
element.short: Determines if the control receives focus when the Buddy control is clicked.

descr.p: FocusOnBuddyClick is a Boolean property which determines if the control receives focus (and a potential change to the text selection in the editor) when the Buddy control is clicked. The default value for the property is False.
FocusOnBuddyClick is used in the implementation of the BuddyClick method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.IsMasked
element.short: Indicates if an edit mask is in use in the BaseEditor in the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Layout
element.short: Controls the alignment of the edit control and its associate.

descr.p: Layout is a TLeftRight property that determines the setting for the Align property in the BaseEditor and the Buddy controls. The default value for the property is taLeftJustify.
Changing the value in Layout cause the Align properties in the grouped controls to be set to the appropriate values. For example:

dl.dd: Causes the Buddy control to be right aligned (opposite of the editor control).
Causes the Buddy control to be left aligned (opposite of the editor control).

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Spacing
element.short: Spacing used between the BaseEditor and the Buddy controls.

descr.p: Spacing is an Integer property that contains the spacing used between the BaseEditor and the Buddy controls.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.OnBuddyClick
element.short: Event handler signalled when the Buddy control is clicked.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create allocates resources needed for the BaseEditor and Buddy properties prior to calling the inherited constructor. The default values for properties and event handlers are assigned in the constructor, including those needed in the BaseEditor and Buddy properties.
The Buddy control is aligned to the right edge of the current class instance.

BaseEditor is aligned to the remaining client area in the control. Event handlers in BaseEditor are set to the internal methods used to redirect mouse and keyboard events for the current class instance.
Both Buddy and BaseEditor use the current class instance in their Parent properties.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy calls the inherited destructor.
descr.remark: Please note: Resources allocated for BaseEditor and Buddy in the constructor are not explicitly freed in the destructor; that action is performed using the Notification that occurs when this class instance (which is the owner for those resources) is freed.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SetFocus
element.short: Sets the focus to the editor in the control.

descr.p: SetFocus is an overridden procedure which gives focus to the grouped edit control. SetFocus redirects the method call to the SetFocus method in the BaseEditor for the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Focused
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control receives focus.

descr.p: Focused is an overridden Boolean function used to perform actions needed when the control receives focus. Focused calls the Focused method in the BaseEditor for the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Focused.Result
element.short: True when the control has focus.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Clear
element.short: Removes the text content in the control.

descr.p: Clear is a procedure used to remove the text content in the control. Clear class the Clear method in BaseEditor.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.ClearSelection
element.short: Clears the content for the current selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CopyToClipboard
element.short: Copies content in the control to the clipboard.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CutToClipboard
element.short: Copies content in the control to the clipboard, and removes it from the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.PasteFromClipboard
element.short: Pastes content into the control from the clipboard.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SelectAll
element.short: Selects all of the content in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Undo
element.short: Reverses the last edit performed on the control value.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.ValidateEdit
element.short: Performs actions needed to validate the value for the control.

descr.p: ValidateEdit is a procedure used to perform actions needed to validate the value for the control. The method calls the ValidateEdit method in the BaseEditor member to validate its Text against the edit mask assigned to the property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.AutoSize
element.short: Allows automatic adjustment of the size for the control, according to its content.

descr.p: AutoSize is a Boolean property redeclared in TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit with an overridden write access specifiers. AutoSize allows the control to automatically adjustment its size to the content in the control.
The default value for the property is True.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.AutoSizeHeightIsEditHeight
element.short: Indicates if the height for BaseEditor is used as the height for the control when autosizing.

descr.p: AutoSizeHeightIsEditHeight is a Boolean property which indicates if the height for BaseEditor is used as the height for the control when autosizing is enabled. The default value for the property is True.
AutoSizeHeightIsEditHeight is used in the implementation of the CalculatePreferredSize method called when CanAutoSize is True.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Alignment
element.short: Indicates the text alignment used for the control value.

descr.p: Alignment is a TAlignment property which indicates the text alignment used for the control value in the BaseEditor control. Read and write access for the property value are redirected to the BaseEditor control.
The default value for the property is taLeftJustify.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CanUndo
element.short: Indicates if the Undo method can used to revert changes to the control value.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CaretPos
element.short: Position of the editing caret in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.CharCase
element.short: Controls the case conversion used for a value entered in the control.

descr.p: CharCase is a TEditCharCase property that controls the case conversion used (if any) for a value entered in the control. The default value for the property is ecNormal, and indicates that no case conversion is used. See TEditCharCase for more information about the enumeration values supported for the type.
Read and write access to the property value are redirected to the BaseEditor control.
descr.remark: Please note: The value in CharCase can automatically be changed to ecNormal when an edit mask is assigned to the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.ParentColor
element.short: Indicates if the color in the Parent control is used.

descr.p: ParentColor is a Boolean property which indicates if the Color from the Parent control is used instead the value assigned to the control. When this property is True, all changes to Color in the parent will also be applied to the Color in the control, ensuring that they both contain the same value. If the Color of the control is changed by the application, then ParentColor will be automatically set to False.
Read and write access to the property value are redirected to the BaseEditor control. The defaul value for the property is False.

Using ParentColor when the Color value is clDefault can cause problems in resolving the actual color value. To obtain the Color property of a control while taking into account clDefault and ParentColor, use the GetColorResolvingParent method. This method might return a non-RGB color, but will never return clDefault. To obtain a purely RGB result use the GetRGBColorResolvingParent method.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.EchoMode
element.short: Indicates if characters entered in the control value are hidden, displayed, or obscured.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.HideSelection
element.short: Hides the current text selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.MaxLength
element.short: Maximum number of characters allowed in the editor for the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.Modified
element.short: Indicates if the content in the control has been changed.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.NumbersOnly
element.short: Indicates that only numbers can be entered in the control value.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.PasswordChar
element.short: Contains the character displayed when entering a password value.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.PopupMenu
element.short: PopupMenu for the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.ReadOnly
element.short: Indicates if value in the control cannot be changed.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SelLength
element.short: Number of characters in the current selection for the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SelStart
element.short: Starting position for the current selection in the control.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.SelText
element.short: Returns the selected text in the control.

descr.p: GetSelText is a String function used to get the selected text in the grouped edit control. Read and write access to the property are redirected to the BaseEdit property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.TabStop
element.short: Indicates if the control can be reached using Tab navigation.

descr.p: TabStop is a Boolean property which indicates if the control can be accessed using Tab or Shift+Tab keyboard navigation. Read and write access to the property value is redirected to the BaseEditor property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.TextHint
element.short: Contains the hint text displayed for the grouped edit control.

descr.p: TextHint is a TTranslateString property which contains the hint text displayed for the grouped edit control. Read and write access to the property value are redirected to the BaseEditor property.

element.name: TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit.OnChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when the value for the control is changed.

descr.p: OnChange is a TNotifyEvent property that contains the event handler signalled when the value for the control is changed. OnChange is triggered from the EditChange method called when the BaseEditor control has modified its value.
OnUTF8KeyPress uses the InternalOnEditUtf8KeyPress method as the default event handler for the control, as assigned in the Create constructor.
